ExecutableTestSuite.label: Conformance class: Application schema, Statistical Units Vector
ExecutableTestSuite.description:
This test suite examines requirements associated with the application schema.

This is a draft version. It has limitations and is expected to contain errors. Please report any issues or problems in GitHub.

Known limitations are documented in the description of the applicable test case or test assertion. There is a general limitation in all assertions that extensions in additional application schemas are only supported, if the unqualified name of the feature type in the extension is the same as the name of the feature type in the INSPIRE application schema.

Source: Conformance Class 'Application Schema, Statistical Units Vector'

Pre-requisite conformance classes:
  • Conformance Class 'Application Schema, Statistical Units Base'
ExecutableTestSuite.author: Consortium Bilbomatica, Guadaltel y Geograma

ParameterList.name: ETF Standard Parameters for XML test objects

TestCase.label: Code lists
TestCase.description: Verify whether all attributes whose value type is a code list take the values set out therein

TestAssertion.label: su-vector-as.a.1: geometryType
TestAssertion.description:
Check that all the geometryType elements has a xlink:href attribute pointing to a pre-defined value.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (1): For the exchange and classification of spatial objects from data sets meeting the conditions laid down in Article 4 of Directive 2007/2/EC, Member States shall use the spatial object types and associated data types, enumerations and code lists that are defined in Annexes II, III and IV for the themes the data sets relate to.
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (3): The enumerations and code lists used in attributes or association roles of spatial object types or data types shall comply with the definitions and include the values set out in Annex II. The enumeration and code list values are uniquely identified by language-neutral mnemonic codes for computers. The values may also include a language-specific name to be used for human interaction.
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (1): Code lists shall be of one of the following types, as specified in the Annexes:
    1. code lists whose allowed values comprise only the values specifiedin this Regulation;
    2. code lists whose allowed values comprise the values specified in this Regulation and narrower values defined by data providers;
    3. code lists whose allowed values comprise the values specified in this Regulation and additional values at any level defined by data providers;
    4. code lists, whose allowed values comprise any values defined by data providers.
    For the purposes of points (b), (c) and (d), in addition to the allowed values, data providers may use the values specified inthe relevant INSPIRE Technical Guidance document available on the INSPIRE web site of the Joint Research Centre.
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (2): Code lists may be hierarchical. Values of hierarchical code lists may have a more generic parent value. Where the valid values of a hierarchical code list are specified in a table in this Regulation, the parent values are listed in the last column.
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (3): Where, for anattribute whose type is a code list as referred to in points (b), (c) or (d) of paragraph 1, a data provider provides a value that is not specified in this Regulation, that value and its definition shall be made available in a register
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (4): Attributes or association roles of spatial object types or data types whose type is a code list may only take values that are allowed according to the specification of the code list.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Code list values', INSPIRE Data Specification on Statistical Units, A.1.3

TestCase.label: Constraints
TestCase.description: Verify that the features provided in the dataset adhere to the constraints specified in the INSPIRE application schema.

TestAssertion.label: su-vector-as.b.1: AreaStatisticalUnits
TestAssertion.description:
Check that vector statistical units with a reference geometry instance of GM_MultiSurface are instances of the specialised class AreaStatisticalUnit.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (2): Types for the Exchange and Classification of Spatial Objects. Spatial object types and data types shall comply with the definitions and constraints and include the attributes and association roles set out in the Annexes.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Constraints', INSPIRE Data Specification on Statistical Units, A.1.6
TestAssertion.expression:
let $property_string := 'AreaStatisticalUnits' let $features_selected := $features[self::su-vector:VectorStatisticalUnit] let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected/su-vector:geometry/su-vector:VectorStatisticalUnitGeometry let $envDom := $feature/su-vector:geometry/gml:MultiSurface let $featurems := if (exists($envDom)) then $feature else() for $featurerg in $featurems/su-vector:geometryDescriptor/su-vector:GeometryDescriptor let $envDomgt:= $featurerg/su-vector:geometryType return if ($envDomgt/@xlink:href = 'http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/GeometryTypeValue/referenceGeometry') then local:addMessage('TR.constraintViolation', map { 'filename': local:filename($feature/../..), 'featureType': local-name($feature/../..), 'gmlid': string($feature/../../@gml:id), 'constraint': 'vector statistical units with a reference geometry instance of GM_MultiSurface are instances of the specialised class AreaStatisticalUnit', 'additionalInfo':''}) else()
return (if ($messages) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)

TestAssertion.label: su-vector-as.b.2: AreaStatisticalUnits II
TestAssertion.description:
Check that the reference geometry of an area statistical units is a GM_MultiSurface or GM_Surface.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (2): Types for the Exchange and Classification of Spatial Objects. Spatial object types and data types shall comply with the definitions and constraints and include the attributes and association roles set out in the Annexes.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Constraints', INSPIRE Data Specification on Statistical Units, A.1.6
TestAssertion.expression:
let $property_stringgt := 'geometryType' let $property_string := 'AreaStatisticalUnits II' let $features_selected := $features[self::su-vector:AreaStatisticalUnit] let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected/su-vector:geometry/su-vector:VectorStatisticalUnitGeometry let $envDomms := $feature/su-vector:geometry/gml:MultiSurface let $envDoms := $feature/su-vector:geometry/gml:Surface
for $featurerg in $feature/su-vector:geometryDescriptor/su-vector:GeometryDescriptor let $envDomgt:= $featurerg/su-vector:geometryType
return if (count($envDomgt) > 1) then local:addMessage('TR.wrongMultiplicity', map {'filename': local:filename($feature/../..), 'featureType':local-name($feature/../..), 'gmlid': string($feature/../../@*:id), 'element': $property_stringgt, 'multiplicity': 1, 'count': count($envDomgt)}) else if (not(exists($envDomms)) and not(exists($envDoms)) and $envDomgt/@xlink:href = 'http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/GeometryTypeValue/referenceGeometry') then local:addMessage('TR.constraintViolation', map { 'filename': local:filename($feature/../..), 'featureType': local-name($feature/../..), 'gmlid': string($feature/../../@gml:id), 'constraint': 'the reference geometry of an area statistical units is a GM_MultiSurface or GM_Surface', 'additionalInfo':''}) else () return (if ($messages) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)

TestAssertion.label: su-vector-as.b.3: GeneralisedGeometry
TestAssertion.description:
Check that the mostDetailedScale and leastDetailedScale fields are provided only for geometry descriptors with a type generalisedGeometry

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (2): Types for the Exchange and Classification of Spatial Objects. Spatial object types and data types shall comply with the definitions and constraints and include the attributes and association roles set out in the Annexes.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Constraints', INSPIRE Data Specification on Statistical Units, A.1.6
TestAssertion.expression:
let $property_stringgt := 'geometryType' let $features_selected := $features[self::su-vector:AreaStatisticalUnit | self::su-vector:VectorStatisticalUnit]
let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected/su-vector:geometry/su-vector:VectorStatisticalUnitGeometry/su-vector:geometryDescriptor/su-vector:GeometryDescriptor let $envDommds := $feature/su-vector:mostDetailedScale let $envDomlds := $feature/su-vector:leastDetailedScale let $envDomgt := $feature/su-vector:geometryType
return if ((not ($envDomgt/@xlink:href = 'http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/GeometryTypeValue/generalisedGeometry')) and (exists($envDomlds) or exists($envDommds))) then local:addMessage('TR.constraintViolation', map { 'filename': local:filename($feature/../../../..), 'featureType':local-name($feature/../../../..), 'gmlid': string($feature/../../../../@*:id), 'constraint': 'the mostDetailedScale and leastDetailedScale fields are provided only for geometry descriptors with a type generalisedGeometry', 'additionalInfo': ''}) else ()
return (if ($messages) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)

TestAssertion.label: su-vector-as.b.4: ScaleRelation
TestAssertion.description:
Check that, if provided, mostDetailedScale is smaller than leastDetailedScale

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (2): Types for the Exchange and Classification of Spatial Objects. Spatial object types and data types shall comply with the definitions and constraints and include the attributes and association roles set out in the Annexes.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Constraints', INSPIRE Data Specification on Statistical Units, A.1.6
TestAssertion.expression:
let $property_stringmds := "mostDetailedScale" let $property_stringlds := "leastDetailedScale" let $features_selected := $features[self::su-vector:AreaStatisticalUnit | self::su-vector:VectorStatisticalUnit]
let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected/su-vector:geometry/su-vector:VectorStatisticalUnitGeometry/su-vector:geometryDescriptor/su-vector:GeometryDescriptor let $envDommds := $feature/su-vector:mostDetailedScale let $envDomlds := $feature/su-vector:leastDetailedScale
return if (count($envDommds) > 1) then local:addMessage('TR.wrongMultiplicity', map {'filename': local:filename($feature/../../../..), 'featureType':local-name($feature/../../../..), 'gmlid': string($feature/../../../../@*:id), 'element': $property_stringmds, 'multiplicity': '0 or 1', 'count': count($envDommds)}) else if (count($envDomlds) > 1) then local:addMessage('TR.wrongMultiplicity', map {'filename': local:filename($feature/../../../..), 'featureType':local-name($feature/../../../..), 'gmlid': string($feature/../../../../@*:id), 'element': $property_stringlds, 'multiplicity': '0 or 1', 'count': count($envDomlds)}) else if (exists($envDommds) and exists($envDomlds) and (number(normalize-space($envDommds)) >= number(normalize-space($envDomlds)))) then local:addMessage('TR.constraintViolation', map { 'filename': local:filename($feature/../../../..), 'featureType':local-name($feature/../../../..), 'gmlid': string($feature/../../../../@*:id), 'constraint': 'mostDetailedScale is smaller than leastDetailedScale', 'additionalInfo': ''}) else ()
return (if ($messages) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)

TestAssertion.label: su-vector-as.b.5: Evolution representations
TestAssertion.description:
Evolution representations shall be consistent with the versions of the concerned objects.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (2): Types for the Exchange and Classification of Spatial Objects. Spatial object types and data types shall comply with the definitions and constraints and include the attributes and association roles set out in the Annexes.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Constraints', INSPIRE Data Specification on Statistical Units, A.1.6

TestAssertion.label: su-vector-as.b.6: Evolution creation
TestAssertion.description:
An evolution with a typeValue “creation” shall not have any initial unit versions and only one final one.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (2): Types for the Exchange and Classification of Spatial Objects. Spatial object types and data types shall comply with the definitions and constraints and include the attributes and association roles set out in the Annexes.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Constraints', INSPIRE Data Specification on Statistical Units, A.1.6

TestAssertion.label: su-vector-as.b.7: Evolution deletion
TestAssertion.description:
An evolution with a typeValue “deletion” shall have one initial unit versions and no final one.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (2): Types for the Exchange and Classification of Spatial Objects. Spatial object types and data types shall comply with the definitions and constraints and include the attributes and association roles set out in the Annexes.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Constraints', INSPIRE Data Specification on Statistical Units, A.1.6

TestAssertion.label: su-vector-as.b.8: Evolution aggregation
TestAssertion.description:
An evolution with a typeValue “aggregation” shall have at least two initial unit versions (the units to be aggregated) and no final one (the resulting aggregation).

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (2): Types for the Exchange and Classification of Spatial Objects. Spatial object types and data types shall comply with the definitions and constraints and include the attributes and association roles set out in the Annexes.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Constraints', INSPIRE Data Specification on Statistical Units, A.1.6

TestAssertion.label: su-vector-as.b.9: Evolution change
TestAssertion.description:
An evolution with a typeValue “change” shall have at one initial unit versions and one final one.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (2): Types for the Exchange and Classification of Spatial Objects. Spatial object types and data types shall comply with the definitions and constraints and include the attributes and association roles set out in the Annexes.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Constraints', INSPIRE Data Specification on Statistical Units, A.1.6

TestAssertion.label: su-vector-as.b.10: Evolution splitting
TestAssertion.description:
An evolution with a typeValue “splitting” shall have a single initial unit versions (the unit to split) and two final at least two final ones (the units resulting from the splitting).

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (2): Types for the Exchange and Classification of Spatial Objects. Spatial object types and data types shall comply with the definitions and constraints and include the attributes and association roles set out in the Annexes.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Constraints', INSPIRE Data Specification on Statistical Units, A.1.6
